      • addBus

        public void addBus(int bus)
        Explicitly add buses to the system so that isolated buses are tracked

      • ensureCapacity

        public boolean ensureCapacity(int maxBusNdx,
                              int branchCount)
        Ensure there is enough storage for the number of buses and branches specified. The algorithm over sizes by a factor of 2 to reduce memory allocation overhead. This check will be performed automatically as needed if the caller can not predict the sizes ahead of time.
        Parameters:
        maxBusNdx - Maximum bus number to be used.
        branchCount - Maximum number of branches.

      • getBranchCount

        public int getBranchCount()
        Return the number of branches in the LinkNet.
        Returns:
        Number of branches.

      • getMaxBusNdx

        public int getMaxBusNdx()
        Return the maximum bus index used plus 1.
        Returns:
        Maximum bus index number plus 1.

      • addBranch

        public int addBranch(int fromBusNdx,
                     int toBusNdx)
        Add a branch. Does not check if a branch already exists
        Parameters:
        fromBusNdx - From bus index of branch
        toBusNdx - To bus index of branch
        Returns:
        branch index

      • findBranch

        public int findBranch(int fromBusNdx,
                      int toBusNdx)
        Look for a branch between the two buses. Will return the first found
        Parameters:
        fromBusNdx - From bus index
        toBusNdx - To bus index
        Returns:
        first branch found or -1 if not found. Does not indicate if more than one parallel branch exist

      • findBranchElim

        public int findBranchElim(int fromBusNdx,
                          int toBusNdx)
        Look for a branch between the two buses, even if is marked as eliminated. Will return the first found.
        Parameters:
        fromBusNdx - From bus index
        toBusNdx - To bus index
        Returns:
        first branch found or -1 if not found. Value <= -2 indicates eliminated, use convertElimBranch() on this value to retrieve the correct branch offset

      • getConnectionCount

        public int getConnectionCount(int busNdx)
        Return the number of connections for a bus.
        Parameters:
        busNdx -
        Returns:
        Number of connections.

      • findBranches

        public int[] findBranches(int busNdx)
        Return all of the branches for a specific bus.
        Parameters:
        busNdx - Starting bus.
        Returns:
        Array of branches.

      • findBranchesElim

        public int[] findBranchesElim(int busNdx)
        Return all of the eliminated branches for a specific bus.
        Parameters:
        busNdx - Starting bus.
        Returns:
        Array of branches.

      • findBuses

        public int[] findBuses(int busNdx)
        Return the buses connected to the specified bus.
        Parameters:
        busNdx - Bus to find connections for.
        Returns:
        Array of connected buses.

      • findConnections

        public int[][] findConnections(int busNdx)
        Return both buses and branches in a single call.
        Returns:
        array of nodes at index 0, and branches at index 1

      • findElimConnections

        public int[][] findElimConnections(int busNdx)
        Return both buses and branches in a single call for eliminated branches.
        Returns:
        array of nodes at index 0, and branches at index 1

      • getAllBuses

        public int[] getAllBuses()
        Return an array of all valid bus indexes. This array will omit any undefined bus indexes.
        Returns:
        array of bus indexes.

        Returns:

      • forEachInGroup

        public void forEachInGroup(int startBus,
                           java.util.function.IntConsumer bf)
        Apply a function to each bus located within group as the given bus. Will also iterate over the given bus. TODO: At some point we should compare this and findGroupMap to see if a common base will perform. Currently, we're duplicating the traversal code TODO: The stack and "seen" arrays are fully-sized, which is probably silly for small islands.
        Parameters:
        startBus -
        bf - Function to apply
